H7045.def: = actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H3147.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gideon<SDBH:גִּדְעֹון>}, the judge of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} who is also known as {L:Jerubbaal<SDBH:יְרֻבַּעַל>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► known for the fable that he told about the inhabitants of {L:Shechem<SDBH:שְׁכֶם>}

H3378.def: = man, also known as {L:Gideon<SDBH:גִּדְעֹון>}; referred to as {L:Jerubbesheth<SDBH:יְרֻבֶּשֶׁת>} in a case of euphemistic substitution; ◄ son of {L:Joash<SDBH:יֹואָשׁ>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► judge of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}
